alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 7:02PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Northampton County through 745 PM EDT... At 702 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Bavon, or 9 miles west of Cape Charles, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Cape Charles, Nassawadox, Cheriton, Willis Wharf, Bay View, Eastville, Capeville, Birdsnest, Kiptopeke State Park, Jamesville, Silver Beach, Machipongo, Wardtown, Franktown, Simpkins, Townsend, Oyster, Kiptopeke, Cheapside and Plantation. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for portions of southeastern Virginia.
